[[Image:Unix history.en.svg|thumb|400px|Unix genealogy tree]]
The '''Unix wars''' were the struggles between [[vendor]]s of the [[Unix]] [[computer]] [[operating system]] in the late 1980s and early 1990s to set the standard for Unix thenceforth. These battles are commonly said to have harmed the market acceptance of Unix and created a market gap that allowed the rise of [[Windows NT]].{{Fact|date=June 2008}}
The '''Unix wars''' were the struggles between [[vendor]]s of the [[Unix]] [[computer]] [[operating system]] in the late 1980s and early 1990s to set the standard for Unix thenceforth. These battles are commonly said to have harmed the market acceptance of Unix and created a market gap that allowed the rise of [[Windows NT]].{{Fact|date=June 2008}}
